info.description:
The CMS Enterprise Data and Analytics Repository (CEDAR) Core API's. 
 These interfaces contain CRUD (where applicable) operations for Budget, Component, Contract, Data Center, Deployment, Exchange, Person, Role Stake Holder, System Detail, System Summary and User.
info.title: CEDAR Core API

tags.name: authority to operate
tags.description: CMS authority to operate (ATO) data from CFACTS

tags.name: budget
tags.description: CMS budget projects funding a particular system

tags.name: contract
tags.description: CMS contracts funded by budget projects

tags.name: domain model
tags.description: Domain heirarchy areas that categorize CMS and Federal agencies' assets

get.summary: Retrieve a list of enumerations based on a list of enumeration names passed in.
get.description: Retrieve a list of enumerations based on a list of enumeration names passed in.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Application where the object or role exists.

parameters.name: names
parameters.description: An array of name of enumerations.

get.summary: Retrieve an existing user in a CEDAR system based on the user name. This interface takes username.
get.description: Retrieve an existing user in a CEDAR system based on the user name. This interface takes username.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of user to retrieve.

put.summary: Update a list existing user in a CEDAR system. This interface takes an array of User documents.
put.description: Update a list existing user in a CEDAR system. This interface takes an array of User documents.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of user to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: User information to be updated in CEDAR.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of contracts based on query criteria. If a SystemId is passed, the contract(s) for that system are returned. If no query data is passed in, all contracts for the current year are returned.
get.description: Retrieve a list of contracts based on query criteria. If a SystemId is passed, the contract(s) for that system are returned. If no query data is passed in, all contracts for the current year are returned.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the system that the contract is associated with

parameters.name: keyword
parameters.description: A keyword to be used in the query

post.summary: Add a new contract(s) to the Alfabet system. This interface takes an arrary of Contract documents.
post.description: Add a new contract(s) to the Alfabet system. This interface takes an arrary of Contract documents.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of Contracts to be added to CEDAR Alfabet.

put.summary: Update an array of contract(s) in the Alfabet system. This interface takes an arrary of Contract documents. If the input budgetsOnly is set to false, this interface will also update any associated Contract Deliverable records.
put.description: Update an array of contract(s) in the Alfabet system. This interface takes an arrary of Contract documents. If the input budgetsOnly is set to false, this interface will also update any associated Contract Deliverable records.

parameters.name: budgetsOnly
parameters.description: Whether only the budgets portion of the contract should be updated or if set to false, the Contract Deliverable records will also be updated.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: An array of contracts to be updated in Alfabet.

delete.summary: Delete a list of contracts based on an array of contarct ids.
delete.description: Delete a list of contracts based on an array of contarct ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An array of contract ids.

get.summary: Retrieve a system summary based on the provided id.
get.description: Retrieve a system summary based on the provided id.

parameters.name: id

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: System state

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: System status

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: System versions

parameters.name: includeInSurvey
parameters.description: Include only system census eligible systems

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Return only system ids and names

parameters.name: belongsTo
parameters.description: Return only sub-systems of the system ID provided

get.summary: Retrieve all versions of a system based on the ICT Object ID.
get.description: Retrieve all versions of a system based on the ICT Object ID.

parameters.name: ictObjectIds
parameters.description: Comma delimited list of ICT Object IDs of systems to retrieve.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the system that the budget is associated with. Adding this parameter will instruct the interface to only return the system matching the systemId.

get.summary: Retrieve an existing person or a sigle person record based on the users EUA id.
get.description: Retrieve an existing person or a sigle person record based on the users EUA id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of person to retrieve.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of available domain reference models
get.description: Retrieves a list of available domain reference models

get.summary: Retrieves the model levels associated with a specific domain reference models
get.description: Retrieves the hierarchy levels associated with a specific domain reference models

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The name of specific reference model to return. A value from the GET /domainModelName endpoint.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of cost types
get.description: Retrieve a list of cost types

parameters.name: application

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of a specific group of cost types

get.summary: Retrieve a list of softwareProducts. This interface takes in id and version.
get.description: Retrieve a list of softwareProducts. This interface takes in id and version.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Application ID.

post.summary: Add a software product that is used by the system
post.description: Add the software product and version details that is used by the system. Software produt can be operating sytems, database, middleware etc. that are needed to perform business function

parameters.name: body

get.summary: Retrieve an existing system based on the provided id.
get.description: Retrieve an existing system based on the provided id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of system to retrieve.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of supportContacts based on the inputs passed in.
get.description: Retrieve a list of supportContact records to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, application id, name, title, url, phone and email.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The applications id.

post.summary: Add a supportContact record to Alfabet.
post.description: Add a supportContact record to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, application id, name, title, url, phone and email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: supportContact information to be added to Alfabet.

delete.summary: Delete a list of supportContacts by ID.
delete.description: Delete a list of supportContacts record to Alfabet. This interface takes an array of supportContact id's.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An array of ids support contacts.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of ATO's based on query criteria
get.description: An Authority to Operate (ATO) is official documentation that an IT asset within a defined boundary has met FISMA security requirements for a limited period of time. ATO security boundaries can encompass business systems, data centers, cloud service provider enclaves, or other IT assets.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the System the ATO was issued for. If provided, all other query parameters are ignored.

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: UUID of the ATO and Corresponding System

parameters.name: fismaSystemAcronym
parameters.description: The system's FISMA acronym.

parameters.name: tlcPhase
parameters.description: A system's lifecycle phase.

parameters.name: containsPersonallyIdentifiableInformation
parameters.description: Does the system collect, maintain, use or share Personally Identifiable Information (PII)?

parameters.name: isProtectedHealthInformation
parameters.description: Is the data maintained in this FISMA system considered electronic Protected Health Information (PHI)?

parameters.name: dispositionDateAfter
parameters.description: ATO's with a retirement or disposition date after the date provided

parameters.name: dispositionDateBefore
parameters.description: ATO's with a retirement or disposition date before the date provided

get.summary: Retrieve a list of stakeholders. This interface takes in id, name, version, state, status and idsOnly.
get.description: Retrieve a list of stakeholders. This interface takes in id, name, version, state, status and idsOnly.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Stakeholder ID.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Stakeholder name.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Stakeholder version.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Stakeholder state.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Stakeholder status.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Return only stakeholder ids and names.

get.summary: Retrieves reference model information about Enterprise Architecture assets
get.description: The Federal Enterprise Architecture Framework (FEAF) v2 describes a suite of tools to help government planners implement the Common Approach. At its core is the Consolidated Reference Model (CRM), which equips OMB and Federal agencies with a common language and framework to describe and analyze investments. It consists of a set of interrelated “reference models” that describe the six subarchitecture domains in the framework: Strategy, Business, Data, Applications, Infrastructure, Security: https://obamawhitehouse.archives.gov/sites/default/files/omb/assets/egov_docs/fea_v2.pdf

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The name of specific model to return. A value from the GET /domainModelName endpoint.

parameters.name: domainModelLevel
parameters.description: The name of a specific model level to return. A value from the GET /domainModelLevel endpoint. If provided, only entries for this specific level of the domain model and its children are returned

parameters.name: domainModelEntry
parameters.description: The name of a specific model value to return. If provided, only entries for this specific value of the domain model and its children are returned

get.summary: Retrieve a list of deployments based on query criteria (systemId, state, status and deploymentType).
get.description: Retrieve a list of deployments based on query criteria (systemId, state, status and deploymentType).

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the system that the deployment is associated with.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Deployment state.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Deployment status.

parameters.name: deploymentType
parameters.description: Deployment type.

post.summary: Add a list of new deployment records to Alfabet. This interface takes in an array of deployments.
post.description: Add a list of new deployment records to Alfabet.  This interface takes in an array of deployments.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Deployment list to be added to CEDAR

put.summary: Update a list of new deployment records to Alfabet.  This interface takes in an array of deployment documents.
put.description: Update a list of new deployment records to Alfabet. This interface takes in an array of deployment documents.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Deployment list to be updated in Alfabet.

delete.summary: Delete a list of deployments based on the ids passed in. This interface takes an array of deploymentIds.
delete.description: Delete a list of deployments based on the ids passed in. This interface takes an array of deploymentIds.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An array of deploymentIds.

get.summary: Retrieve a component
get.description: Retrieve a component record based on the id parameter that is passed in.

parameters.name: componentId
parameters.description: ID of the component to retrieve.

post.summary: This interface takes in a Component record and adds that to Alfabet.
post.description: This interface takes in a Component record and adds that to Alfabet.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Component record to be added to Alfabet.

delete.summary: Deletes a component within Alfabet based on the ID that is passed in.
delete.description: Deletes a component within Alfabet based on the ID that is passed in.

parameters.name: componentId
parameters.description: ID of the component to deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of budgets based on query criteria listed in the parameters section. Passing a SystemId will cause the interface to return the budget(s) for just that system. Setting onlyIds to true will only return the id's, whereas if not set, the response will also include projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding. This interface has a limit of 5000 records.
get.description: Retrieve a list of budgets based on query criteria listed in the parameters section. Passing a SystemId will cause the interface to return the budget(s) for just that system. Setting onlyIds to true will only return the id's, whereas if not set, the response will also include projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding. This interface has a limit of 5000 records.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the system that the budget is associated with. Adding this parameter will instruct the interface to only return the system matching the systemId.

parameters.name: projectTitle
parameters.description: Project Title string to search. Adding this parameter will  instruct the interface to only return the system matching the systemId.

parameters.name: projectId
parameters.description: Project Id string to search. Adding this parameter will  instruct the interface to only return the system matching the projectId.

parameters.name: onlyIds
parameters.description: Whether the call will return simply the IDs. If not set, the response will also include projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Whether the call will return simply the IDs.  If not set, the response will also include projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding.

post.summary: Add new budget(s) to the Alfabet system. This interface takes an array of one or more budget documents (id, projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding).
post.description: Add new budget(s) to the Alfabet system. This interface takes an array of one or more budgets (id, projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Budget(s) to be added to CEDAR.  This required input in a list of Budget documents.

put.summary: Update a existing budget with Alfabet. The input requires an array of one or more budget documents (id, projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding).
put.description: Update a existing budget with Alfabet. The input requires an array of one or more budget documents (id, projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding).

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Budgets to be updated in CEDAR. This required input in a list of Budget documents (id, projectId, systemId, fundingId and funding).

delete.summary: Deletes a list of budgets based on an array of budget ids.
delete.description: Deletes a list of budgets based on an array of budget ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An array of budget ID's that are to be deleted.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of persons based on the inputs passed in.
get.description: Retrieve a list of persons based on the inputs passed in.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A person's EUA id.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: A person's username.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A person's first name.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A person's last name.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A person's phone number.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A person's email.

post.summary: Add a person record to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.
post.description: Add a person record to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Person information to be added to Alfabet.

put.summary: Update a person record to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.
put.description: Update a person record to Alfabet. This interface takes in id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Person information to be updated in Alfabet.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of threats based on a comma delimited list of object IDs.
get.description: Retrieve a list of threats (like a Plan of Actions and Milestones POA&M), for a specific object (like an ATO) using the object's unique ID.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma delimited list of object IDs, for example, an ATO ID.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of URLs associated with an object in CEDAR
get.description: Retrieve a list of URLs associated with an object in CEDAR. An object could include a System, ATO, etc

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of object the URLs are associated with.

get.summary: Finds a list of role assignments based on an object's ID and/or role type.
get.description: Finds a list of role assignments based on an object's ID. If objectId and roleTypeId are both provided, a list of role assignments for only those specific role type IDs are returned. If roleId is provided, then objectId and roleTypeId should not be provided and a specific role assignment is returned.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Application where the object or role exists.

parameters.name: roleId
parameters.description: ID of a specific role assignment.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: ID of the object that roles are assigned to.

parameters.name: roleTypeId
parameters.description: ID of a specific role type to be returned. Used with objectId to limit search results.

post.summary: Add role assignments to a CEDAR application. This interface takes in objectId, roleTypeId AND either assigneeId, assigneeUserName or assigneeOrgId are required.
post.description: Add role assignments to a CEDAR application. This interface takes in objectId, roleTypeId AND either assigneeId, assigneeUserName or assigneeOrgId are required.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Role assignment information to be added to a CEDAR application.

delete.summary: Deletes a list of role assignments by ID. This interface takes an application name and an array of roleIds.
delete.description: Deletes a list of role assignments by ID. This interface takes an application name and an array of roleIds.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The application where the role assignment should be deleted

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An ID of a role assignment within a specific application

get.summary: Finds a list of role types available within an application. This interface takes in application.
get.description: Finds a list of role types available within an application. This interface takes in application. The list of current roles are: AI Contact API Contact Budget Analyst Business Owner Business Question Contact Contracting Officer's Representative (COR) DA Reviewer Data Center Contact ISSO Government Task Lead (GTL) Project Lead QA Reviewer System Maintainer Subject Matter Expert (SME) Support Staff Survey Point of Contact Technical System Issues Contact

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: ID of the object that roles are assigned to.

get.summary: Retrieve an existing user from a CEDAR application. This interface takes an id.
get.description: Retrieve an existing user from a CEDAR application. This interface takes an id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of user to retrieve.

put.summary: Update a list existing user in a CEDAR application.This interface takes an arrary of User documents.
put.description: Update a list existing user in a CEDAR application.This interface takes an arrary of User documents.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of user to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: User information to be updated in CEDAR.

get.summary: Retrieves information about the official CMS organizational hierarchy
get.description: Retrieves information about the official CMS organizational hierarchy as maintained and published by the Division of Performance and Organizational Programs (DPOP)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a specific organization. Will return the organization specified and all children of the organization.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Exact name of a specific organization. Will return the organization specified and all children of the organization.

parameters.name: acronym
parameters.description: Acronym of a specific organization. Will return the organization specified and all children of the organization.

get.summary: Retrieve a data exchange record from Alfabet. This interface takes in a systemId, direction and version.
get.description: Retrieve a data exchange record from Alfabet. This interface takes in a systemId, direction and version.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of exchange to retrieve.

get.summary: Retrieve a system summary list. This interface takes in state, status, version, includeInSurvey, idsOnly and belongsTo.
get.description: Retrieve a system summary list. This interface takes in state, status, version, includeInSurvey, idsOnly and belongsTo.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: System state.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: System status.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: System versions.

parameters.name: includeInSurvey
parameters.description: Include only system census eligible systems.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Return only system ids and names.

parameters.name: belongsTo
parameters.description: Return only sub-systems of the system ID provided.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limits the number of systems returned. If no value is provided, the default is 1000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Defines the starting position of the first record returned. If no value is provided, the default is 0

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: EUA of Person that has a Role associated with any System.

parameters.name: roleType
parameters.description: Role Type of Person that is associated with any System.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of users from a CEDAR application. This interface takes in application, id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.
get.description: Retrieve a list of users from a CEDAR application. This interface takes in application, id, userName, firstName, lastName, phone and email.

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Application the user belongs to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A user's id.

parameters.name: userName
parameters.description: A user's username.

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A user's first name.

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A user's last name.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: A user's phone number.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A users's email.

post.summary: Add users to a CEDAR application. This interface takes an array of User documents.
post.description: Add users to a CEDAR application. This interface takes an array of User documents.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: User information to be added to a CEDAR application.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of data centers based on query criteria (id, name, version, state, status and idsOnly). If idsOnlys is true, only the id and name will be returned.

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: version

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Data center state.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Data center status.

parameters.name: idsOnly
parameters.description: Return only data center ids and names.

get.description: Retrieve a data exchange record from Alfabet. This interface takes in a systemId, direction and version.

parameters.name: systemId
parameters.description: ID of the system that the data exchange is associated with.

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the data exchange, relative to the systemId provided.

parameters.name: version

post.summary: Add a list of data exchange records to Alfabet. This interface takes in an array of exchanges.
post.description: Add a list of data exchange records to Alfabet. This interface takes in an array of exchanges.

put.description: Update a list of data exchange records to Alfabet. This interface takes in an array of exchanges.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Data exchange array to be updated in Alfabet.

delete.summary: Delete a list of data exchanges by ID. This interface takes an array of exchange ids.
delete.description: Delete a list of data exchanges by ID. This interface takes an array of exchange ids.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An array of ids data exchanges.

description.example: This is a CMS System decription

networkEncryption.example: We do not encrypt network traffic leaving our system,We encrypt network traffic leaving our system to other systems on the CMS-internal network

name.example: Accountable Care Organization Management System v.1.0 (COOP DR)

ictObjectId.description: ICT Object ID for a given system

contractDeliverableId.description: Contract deliverable ID tying this budget project to the contract

id.description: OFM budget internal ID in system of record

projectId.description: OFM budget project ID in system of record

enum: Yes, UI accessible by external users.
Yes, UI accessible by internal Federal Employees.
Yes, UI accessible by both internal Federal Employees and external users.
No, this system doesn't have a UI.

exchangeDescription.example: Reference data on vendors acting on behalf of insurance issuers

exchangeName.example: Acumen Web Portals 1.0 >> Drug Data Processing System 1.0

assigneeOrgId.description: ID of the role assignee, if an organization

assigneeUserName.description: Username of the role assignee, if a person

assigneeId.description: ID of the role assignee, if a person

objectType.description: The type of object the role is assigned to

application.description: Application where the role assignment exists

assigneeIsDeleted.description: Indicated the person assigned the role is marked for deletion

objectId.description: ID of the object the role is assiged to

name.example: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services

enum: Yes - This system has developed AI capabilities.
Yes - This system uses a SaaS AI tool like Remesh...
No – And this system currently has no plans to utilize AI capabilities
No – But there currently are plans to use AI capabilities in the next two years
API In development but not yet launched.

isVersionCodeRepository.description: A boolean flag to indicate if this URL provides access to a versioned code repository?

urlHostingEnv.description: The hosting environment associated with a specific URL

isApiEndpoint.description: A boolean flag to indicate whether URL is an API Endpoint

urlId.description: Unique key that uniquely identified the URL in database

isBehindWebApplicationFirewall.description: A boolean flag to indicate whether the application is behind a Web Application Firewall (WAF)

funding.example: Most of this funding is directly and only for this system (over 80%)
funding.description: Description of the allocation of this budget to the system in question

fundingId.description: Cross-reference ID for relationship between budget project and application in system of record

id.description: OFM budget internal ID in system of record

projectId.description: OFM budget project ID in system of record

description.example: This is a CMS System decription

enum: We do not encrypt any network traffic.
We perform ad hoc management of encryption keys.
We have a process for managing encryption keys.
We have a process for managing encryption keys and it is automated.
Another CMS system - Describe in Notes

netAccessibility.example: Accessible to a CMS-internal network only
enum: Accessible to the Public Internet (non-restricted access)
Accessible to a CMS-internal network only
Accessible to both public internet and to CMS-internal network
We do not encrypt data at rest.
We perform ad hoc management of encryption keys.
We have a process for managing encryption keys.
We have a process for managing encryption keys and it is automated.

devWorkDescription.example: The type of development work underway...

enum: One Time Password sent via Email
One Time Password sent via SMS
One Time Password or Push from an authenticator app e.g. Google Authenticator DUO
One time Password from a hardware token e.g. RSA SecurID
FIDO U2F (e.g. YubiKey as a second factor)
Other Provider and Health Plan Records (Hint=2)
Public Use Statistical and Summary Files (Hint=2)
Significant Public Outreach and Engagement Records (Hint=2)
Other Public Outreach and Engagement Records (Hint=2)
Mixed – Uses COTS or GOTS and has more than 20% custom coding

alternativeId.description: ID assigned by a source system. For example, POA&M ID from CFACTS

parentId.description: ID of the object the threat is assigned to
